import numpy as np
A = np.array([[1,2],[3,4]])
b = np.array([[5],[7]])
solution = np.linalg.solve(A,b)
x = solution[0][0]
y = solution[1][0]
print('x = {}'.format(x)) # -3
print('y = {}'.format(y)) # 4

import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import numpy as np
x = np.linspace(-5,5,100)
y = (5-x)/2
plt.plot(x, y, '-r', label='y=(5-x)/2', color='green')
y = (7-x)/4
plt.plot(x, y, '-r', label='y=(7-x)/4', color='blue')
plt.title('Linear Algebra Example 1', color='red')
plt.xlabel('x')
plt.ylabel('y')
plt.legend(loc='upper left')
plt.grid()
plt.show()
